Powder-like substances kept in a single container and which are heavier than 350g (or 350ml) are prohibited by Transportation Security Administration (TSA) in hand-carried bags on all U.S.-based airlines as well as on non-stop flights to the U.S.A. If you need to carry larger amounts of powdered substances, they must be in checked baggage. Exceptions to this include:

Duty-free purchases packed in Security Tamper Evident Bags (STEB). Restrictions may apply. Please check with your respective airline.
Human remains.
Baby formula, if you are travelling with an infant.
Medication, accompanied by a doctor's letter. All powder-like substances in carry-on bags may be subjected to further screening. Please check with your airline for advice before your flight.
